technology.name: Ridin' Stick
technology.description: Some mounts are disobedient and others are just plain dangerous, so it's sometimes necessary to "put a bit of stick about" to keep them in line and focused on the task at hand.

technology.name: Saddlesore Cream
technology.description: All that riding makes one a bit "sensitive and hurty", but this miracle substance, made from the bile leftover from certain types of dinner, works wonders, and in no time.

technology.name: Gold Standard
technology.description: The only forms of currency Ogres will accept are food and gold. When many tribes are working together, agreeing on a standard is vital if healthy relations are to be maintained.

effects.description: Income from sacking and looting settlements: +25%

technology.name: Bait the Trappers
technology.description: Gnoblar Trappers delight in tormenting smaller animals and following Ogre Hunters into battle. Baiting them beforehand ensures that only the fastest, most intrepid candidates may attend.

effects.description: [hidden] Used to increase rank for Hunters from camps in conjunction with regular effect (with different scopes)

technology.name: Ogre Breath
technology.description: Eating crushed limestone reduces cases of 'Ogre Breath' enough so the Ogres can stand closer together and fight in ranks.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Ogre Bulls units

technology.name: Over-Eatin'
technology.description: Though it tends to lead to gut-aches and even-more-chronic flatulence than usual, there's sense in depriving the enemy of supplies, so they have to fight you in a weakened state.

technology.name: Sinew Bindings
technology.description: Winding sinew around weapon handles makes for better grip, which in turn makes them easier to wield.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Ogre Bulls units

technology.name: Finder's Fee
technology.description: It's important to discuss payment from the outset to prevent things going south at a later juncture.

technology.name: Tribal Tribute
technology.description: Understanding that the Tyrant's tribute must be paid, no matter how well things went, is essential if you want to carry on living.

technology.name: Mercenary Tithe
technology.description: A portion of payment extracted for services rendered to others is always sent home. It's just respectful.

technology.name: Heavier Gut Plates
technology.description: All the better for smashing the foe to bits with.

technology.name: Bigga Camps
technology.description: A larger campsite means more groupings of tents, and therefore more Ogres gathered in one place – multiplying the threat level many times over.

technology.name: Gnoblar Scavengin'
technology.description: Those pathetic, snivelling Gnoblars can be leashed and made to sniff out the best loot, and more of it too.

technology.name: Camp Foragin'
technology.description: Once you get a handle on the local food supply, things start to come together quite well, quite quickly, regardless of how far the Ogres are from home.

effects.description: Camp growth: +20 when in enemy territory

technology.name: Dinner Gong
technology.description: Now the whole camp can eat together – bringing a bit of decorum to proceedings, you might say. Almost.

effects.description: Control: -4 in enemy provinces where an army is present

technology.name: Contract Scrawls
technology.description: Even Ogres know that keeping records of agreements can avoid the more violent forms of disagreement further down the track; simply sign your name with an 'X'.

technology.name: Live Bait
technology.description: Gorgers like their meat raw or recently slaughtered, so the best kind of bait is the kind that's still wriggling.

technology.name: Battlefield Butchery
technology.description: Every last ounce must be scoured from the bones. Nothing should be wasted.

technology.name: Trapper's Instincts
technology.description: After a while spent trapping for a Hunter, a Gnoblar Trapper develops a sense – as well as a nose – for their prey.

technology.name: Camp Site Cullin'
technology.description: Determining the best place to set up camp? It's a process of elimination.

technology.name: Iron-Capped Teeth
technology.description: Iron makes teeth better, so they cause more damage. Obviously.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +5% for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorn, Gorgers, and Giant units

technology.name: Mawtooth Fealty
technology.description: At the heart of every camp lies the Mawtooth stone. The Ogres will fight harder, and with every last breath and ounce of strength, to ensure it is protected.

technology.name: Camp Huddle
technology.description: A couple of Ogres having a conflab quickly becomes a huddle as more and more gather around them.

technology.name: Ogre Throng
technology.description: When several smaller Ogre camps become large enough and touch, a bigger gathering – a throng – is formed.

technology.name: Bigga Tents
technology.description: It's a bit fiddly, but some Ogres have a natural affinity for such things, and are able to make tents big enough to house a huddle or more.

technology.name: Tribal Gathering
technology.description: Here, all the Ogres of the tribe sit together in one place to eat and make plans (chiefly, to eat even more).

technology.name: Big Migration
technology.description: Signalling that the several tribes that make up an Ogre kingdom are on the move, as a single, brutish, hungry horde.

technology.name: Stonehorn Breeding
technology.description: These enormous, woolly beasts are notoriously dense, even by Ogre standards, and therefore require a bit of 'encouragement' in the breeding department.

technology.name: Stop it Rottin'
technology.description: Believe it or not, it's not always possible to eat all the available meat in one go, so it's necessary to develop preservation techniques if you don't want to see good food go to waste.

technology.name: Huntin' Tricks
technology.description: As it turns out, many of the Ogres' natural prey are a bit thick and can be tricked into giving up their lives without expending too much effort.

technology.name: Whetstones
technology.description: Sharper weapons do more damage, something many Ogres learn from watching their Butcher at work.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Ogre Bulls units

technology.name: Butcher's Spices
technology.description: Whatever it is he's using to flavour the meat makes it taste nicer, and has some healing properties too.

technology.name: Bigga Spit
technology.description: The bigger the spit, the bigger the meal, the more satisfied the diners.

technology.name: Ravening Hordes
technology.description: Keep 'em hungry, keep 'em mean.

technology.name: Preachers of Fire
technology.description: "The Firebellies are comin' – time for a feast! Who's for some flametoad and devilpepper curry?"

effects.description: [hidden] Used to increase rank for Firebellies from camps in conjunction with regular effect (with different scopes)

technology.name: Gone-Off Meat
technology.description: This meat's well past its best, but hardy Ogre constitutions can probably still handle it. The price reflects this.

technology.name: Better Plunder
technology.description: The Maneaters have spent their long lives accumulating wealth abroad on campaign as mercenaries for foreign powers, which has given them a nose for the best plunder.

technology.name: Mournfang Scent
technology.description: The natural musk of a mighty Mournfang, bizarrely, will attract other animals – ones you want to trap, kill and bung on a spit over the fire with haste.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Mournfang Cavalry units

technology.name: Trade Negotiator
technology.description: This one's not much of a talker, but more of an imposing presence who cracks his knuckles a lot, which speaks volumes to his opposite numbers.

technology.name: Stolen Black Powder Recipe
technology.description: Scrolls appropriated from Cathay have revealed their deadly secrets…

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +10% for Ironblaster units

technology.name: Betta Bribes
technology.description: Gold is useful for opening ears to new ideas.

technology.name: Larger Fire Pits
technology.description: A bigger pit allows for more meat to be cooked at one time, so many mouths can be fed in a single sitting.

technology.name: Protection Racket
technology.description: "Somefing could 'appen, yer know? You wouldn't wan' there to be an 'accident', now would yer?"

technology.name: Fire Mouth Tribute
technology.description: The volcanic peak kills many when it erupts, so making sure the Fire Mouth gods are appeased should be high on any self-respecting leader's list of things to do.

technology.name: Warpstone Rub
technology.description: Applying Warpstone to steaks before cooking them keeps the number of mutations down.

effects.description: Attrition: -50% casualties suffered from Chaos Undivided corruption and Chaos Wastes attrition

technology.name: Trade 'Relations'
technology.description: Simply promising not to eat the foreign envoys puts trade negotiations on a better footing from the outset.

effects.description: Income from trade: +5% for every ally

technology.name: Choosiest Weapons
technology.description: As the Tyrant's super-hard elite guard, Ironguts naturally get the best armour and weapons available to the tribe.

technology.name: Sky-Titan Defences
technology.description: The megalithic defences of this long-gone race were built into the mountains themselves. It's not completely beyond the Ogres to work out how to use them, but almost.

effects.description:
Defensive supplies: +500 per turn when under siege
	(factionwide)

technology.name: Scrap Collectors
technology.description: If you hit, throw and generally abuse them enough, Gnoblars occasionally have good ideas – in this instance, a Rhinox-drawn scoop for picking up all the scrap.

effects.description: Upkeep: -50% for Gnoblars and Gnoblar Scraplauncher units

technology.name: Belonging to da Maw
technology.description: Some hungry Ogre souls were born to serve the Great Maw.

technology.name: Butcher's Apron
technology.description: Recipes and spells are scrawled upon the aprons of the Slaughtermasters and Butchers, steeping them in magic and causing them to absorb even more of the stuff.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve change: +20% when increasing
	(all armies)

technology.name: Sky-Titan Plateaus
technology.description: The long-abandoned fortresses of the, rarely, if ever-assailed Sky-Titans make ideal campsites for the brighter Ogre tribes.

effects.description: Camp limit: +1 for every level 5 camp built
